trans-unit.source: Provides a checklist to help you ensure that your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app is accessible.
trans-unit.target: Provides a checklist to help you ensure that your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app is accessible.

trans-unit.source: Accessibility checklist
trans-unit.target: Accessibility checklist

trans-unit.source: Accessibility checklist
trans-unit.target: Accessibility checklist

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Provides a checklist to help you ensure that your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app is accessible.
trans-unit.target: Provides a checklist to help you ensure that your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app is accessible.

trans-unit.source: Here we provide a checklist you can use to ensure that your app is accessible.
trans-unit.target: Here we provide a checklist you can use to ensure that your app is accessible.

trans-unit.source: Set the accessible name (required) and description (optional) for content and interactive UI elements in your app.
trans-unit.target: Set the accessible name (required) and description (optional) for content and interactive UI elements in your app.

trans-unit.source: An accessible name is a short, descriptive text string that a screen reader uses to announce a UI element.
trans-unit.target: An accessible name is a short, descriptive text string that a screen reader uses to announce a UI element.

trans-unit.source: Some UI elements such as [**TextBlock**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209652) and [**TextBox**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209683) promote their text content as the default accessible name; see [Basic accessibility information](basic-accessibility-information.md#name-from-inner-text).
trans-unit.target: Some UI elements such as [**TextBlock**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209652) and [**TextBox**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209683) promote their text content as the default accessible name; see [Basic accessibility information](basic-accessibility-information.md#name-from-inner-text).

trans-unit.source: You should set the accessible name explicitly for images or other controls that do not promote inner text content as an implicit accessible name.
trans-unit.target: You should set the accessible name explicitly for images or other controls that do not promote inner text content as an implicit accessible name.

trans-unit.source: You should use labels for form elements so that the label text can be used as a [**LabeledBy**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh759769) target in the Microsoft UI Automation model for correlating labels and inputs.
trans-unit.target: You should use labels for form elements so that the label text can be used as a [**LabeledBy**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh759769) target in the Microsoft UI Automation model for correlating labels and inputs.

trans-unit.source: If you want to provide more UI guidance for users than is typically included in the accessible name, accessible descriptions and tooltips help users understand the UI.
trans-unit.target: If you want to provide more UI guidance for users than is typically included in the accessible name, accessible descriptions and tooltips help users understand the UI.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Accessible name](basic-accessibility-information.md#accessible-name) and [Accessible description](basic-accessibility-information.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Accessible name](basic-accessibility-information.md#accessible-name) and [Accessible description](basic-accessibility-information.md).

trans-unit.source: Implement keyboard accessibility:
trans-unit.target: Implement keyboard accessibility:

trans-unit.source: Test the default tab index order for a UI.
trans-unit.target: Test the default tab index order for a UI.

trans-unit.source: Adjust the tab index order if necessary, which may require enabling or disabling certain controls, or changing the default values of [**TabIndex**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209461) on some of the UI elements.
trans-unit.target: Adjust the tab index order if necessary, which may require enabling or disabling certain controls, or changing the default values of [**TabIndex**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209461) on some of the UI elements.

trans-unit.source: Use controls that support arrow-key navigation for composite elements.
trans-unit.target: Use controls that support arrow-key navigation for composite elements.

trans-unit.source: For default controls, the arrow-key navigation is typically already implemented.
trans-unit.target: For default controls, the arrow-key navigation is typically already implemented.

trans-unit.source: Use controls that support keyboard activation.
trans-unit.target: Use controls that support keyboard activation.

trans-unit.source: For default controls, particularly those that support the UI Automation [**Invoke**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR242582) pattern, keyboard activation is typically available; check the documentation for that control.
trans-unit.target: For default controls, particularly those that support the UI Automation [**Invoke**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR242582) pattern, keyboard activation is typically available; check the documentation for that control.

trans-unit.source: Set access keys or implement accelerator keys for specific parts of the UI that support interaction.
trans-unit.target: Set access keys or implement accelerator keys for specific parts of the UI that support interaction.

trans-unit.source: For any custom controls that you use in your UI, verify that you have implemented these controls with correct [**AutomationPeer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209185) support for activation, and defined overrides for key handling as needed to support activation, traversal and access or accelerator keys.
trans-unit.target: For any custom controls that you use in your UI, verify that you have implemented these controls with correct [**AutomationPeer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209185) support for activation, and defined overrides for key handling as needed to support activation, traversal and access or accelerator keys.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Keyboard interactions](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt185607).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Keyboard interactions](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt185607).

trans-unit.source: Visually verify your UI to ensure that the text contrast is adequate, elements render correctly in the high-contrast themes, and colors are used correctly.
trans-unit.target: Visually verify your UI to ensure that the text contrast is adequate, elements render correctly in the high-contrast themes, and colors are used correctly.

trans-unit.source: Use the system display options that adjust the display's dots per inch (dpi) value, and ensure that your app UI scales correctly when the dpi value changes.
trans-unit.target: Use the system display options that adjust the display's dots per inch (dpi) value, and ensure that your app UI scales correctly when the dpi value changes.

trans-unit.source: (Some users change dpi values as an accessibility option, it's available from **Ease of Access**.)
trans-unit.target: (Some users change dpi values as an accessibility option, it's available from **Ease of Access**.)

trans-unit.source: Use a color analyzer tool to verify that the visual text contrast ratio is at least 4.5:1.
trans-unit.target: Use a color analyzer tool to verify that the visual text contrast ratio is at least 4.5:1.

trans-unit.source: Switch to a high contrast theme and verify that the UI for your app is readable and usable.
trans-unit.target: Switch to a high contrast theme and verify that the UI for your app is readable and usable.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that your UI doesn’t use color as the only way to convey information.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that your UI doesn’t use color as the only way to convey information.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [High-contrast themes](high-contrast-themes.md) and [Accessible text requirements](accessible-text-requirements.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [High-contrast themes](high-contrast-themes.md) and [Accessible text requirements](accessible-text-requirements.md).

trans-unit.source: Run accessibility tools, address reported issues, and verify the screen reading experience.
trans-unit.target: Run accessibility tools, address reported issues, and verify the screen reading experience.

trans-unit.source: Use tools such as [**Inspect**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Dd318521) to verify programmatic access, run diagnostic tools such as [**AccChecker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Hh920985) to discover common errors, and verify the screen reading experience with Narrator.
trans-unit.target: Use tools such as [**Inspect**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Dd318521) to verify programmatic access, run diagnostic tools such as [**AccChecker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Hh920985) to discover common errors, and verify the screen reading experience with Narrator.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Accessibility testing](accessibility-testing.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Accessibility testing](accessibility-testing.md).

trans-unit.source: Make sure your app manifest settings follow accessibility guidelines.
trans-unit.target: Make sure your app manifest settings follow accessibility guidelines.

trans-unit.source: Declare your app as accessible in the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: Declare your app as accessible in the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: If you implemented the baseline accessibility support, declaring your app as accessible in the Windows Store can help reach more customers and get some additional good ratings.
trans-unit.target: If you implemented the baseline accessibility support, declaring your app as accessible in the Windows Store can help reach more customers and get some additional good ratings.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Accessibility in the Store](accessibility-in-the-store.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Accessibility in the Store](accessibility-in-the-store.md).
